page.title: 12HALLATON CLUBS & SOCIETIES 1
page.content: Many of the clubs and activities in Hallaton are associated with the Church. There is a fortnightly{Sunday {School.}Guides meet every Friday in the Church Hut. On Monday mornings, people gather for the{"Coffee Set"}for a chat or to listen to a talk at the Rectory. On Wednesday afternoons, also at the Rectory, a{mothers and toddlers {group}meets. In 1984 the Church {Bellringing Association}was revived (there are six bells in the church). An enthusiastic band of about 12 locals ring for Sunday services and a midweek practice. The group also rings the eight handbells belonging to the Church. Fortnightly on Thursday afternoons the{Evergreen Club}for pensioners meets at the Stenning Hall for tea, bingo and whist. The club also goes on many outings in the Summer.
